label: [Label(name="enhancement")]

Some TLS certificates are causing issues on some Reader installations :
- Startcom (aka StartSSL) is not installed in any Oracle JDK
- Let's Encrypt is not installed on Oracle JDK7, and JDK8 < JDK8u101

Add an option to trust all certificates (set to true by default) : ssl.trust.all

This defines an insecure Trust manager that is used by the Reader HTTP client.

Checking can be reenabled by setting system property -Dssl.trust.all=true

title: The polling is too strong
body:
The polling is too strong. a weak server is bombarded quickly

Wouldn't it be better a kind of message queue handler to build. A message handler could thus reduce the load considerably. The message handler waits until a request is finished and then sends the next request.

i use a raspberry and overclock it to 950 MHz, at the moment with one client.
I know 950MHz is not much but it should still be enough. its only a rss reader.

here you can see the waiting request.

![sismics-reader](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/751811/1207246/c7ecab52-25b1-11e3-8c2b-f88db90e9415.jpg)

if you wait until the request is finish and then only send the next request, I think it would go faster and the server would not be so overloaded, instead of every seconds to fire off  :-)
